Milt
Jingo eagles are not meant to be lifelike in the way, say that the Ishiguro would depict them but they are very powerful images of eagles. Your eagle/hawk is very stiff in execution and coarsely carved.
Alan
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: bungotakadasword 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Friday, April 14, 2006 4:56 PM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] in defense of the ugly bird or seeking more " punishment "


  all of you diss the hawk tsuba as some sort of " mono "........ base on 
  the ugly execution of the bird.
  Now tell me........ you find the eagle/hawk as portrait in Jingo tsuba 
  ugly ? Life-like as those by Ishiguro school ?
  So.......... why is it so highly treasured ?  Because the birds are 
  ugly ?  Or because they say it is " good " and so it is....... ?( sort 
  of like there's WMD because i said there  is ?  =)   )

  p.s.  the hawk is gold ( not paint ), not copper/brass based as it 
  doesn't stain with " magic solution " that stain copper/brass, yes, i 
  tried.


  milt
